mendel.serialize

Class SerializationOutputStream

    • Method Detail

      • writeString

        public void writeString(java.lang.String field)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a String to the output stream. The field is prefixed with the String length. null Strings are not allowed here; use an empty String instead.
        Parameters:
        field - The String to write to the output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeField

        public void writeField(byte[] field)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a byte array (byte field) to the output stream. When serialized, the array will be prefixed with its length.
        Parameters:
        field - The byte array to write to the output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeCompressableField

        public void writeCompressableField(byte[] field,
                          boolean compress)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a field that can be compressed. This method is similar to writeField(), but has an additional boolean flag that tells the serialization framework whether or not the data is compressed. This is helpful in situations where compression might be toggled on or off by the user at run time or during configuration.
        Parameters:
        field - The byte array to write to the stream
        compress - Whether the byte field should be compressed or not.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeSerializableCollection

        public void writeSerializableCollection(java.util.Collection<? extends ByteSerializable> object)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeStringCollection

        public void writeStringCollection(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> collection)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeSimpleMap

        public void writeSimpleMap(SimpleMap<?,? extends ByteSerializable> map)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeSerializable

        public void writeSerializable(ByteSerializable object)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a ByteSerializable object to this output stream. This method is equivalent to simply calling object.serialize() directly, but fits into the normal serialization "flow" a bit better because it matches the other methods in this class.
        Parameters:
        object - ByteSerializable object to serialize.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setCompressionLevel

        public void setCompressionLevel(int compressionLevel)
        Sets the compression level (1-9) when writing serializable fields using gzip.
        Parameters:
        compressionLevel - compression level this output stream will use when writing compressible fields.
